intro: Bupleurum gramineum f. laxiusculum, commonly known as the slender leafed bupleurum, is a variant of the bupleurum species characterized by its slender and elongated leaves. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. This plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. The plant is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
